str2: When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
Of Chaldee origin; the Rock; Cephas, a surname of Peter.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From Antiochus; Antiochia, a place in Syria.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To set against; I withstand, resist, oppose. From anti and histemi; to stand against, i.e. Oppose.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To condemn, blame. From kata and ginosko; to note against, i.e. Find fault with.
